info.name: Witness Protection
info.attribution:
Card layout by mousewax and available under CC0. Dexdouglas wrote character text hints. All other room layout, design, and scripting are by LawDawg96. Released to the Public Domain under CC0.

The card back for the Bad Guy characters was created by the Google Gemini AI (https://gemini.google.com/) using the following prompt: "1:1 square minimalist card back design. Dark, desaturated background with a subtle central motif formed from overlapping shadows and worn textures, suggesting secrecy and hierarchy without literal imagery. Aged letterpress feel, soft contrast, and visible paper grain. Clean edges, symmetrical framing, and high legibility at card size. Mood is controlled, serious, and ominous without theatrical noir lighting."

The library image and the card back for the Good Guy characters was also created by Google Gemini with the following prompt: "Now make a similar one for the good guys. Lighter tones. Less ominous imagery."

The character images were created by the Microsoft Copilot AI (https://copilot.microsoft.com/) using various prompts to describe the mood and characters similar to: "1:1 square image of a _________. Figure should be standing. Only include accessories appropriate to the role/occupation. Style: Muted 1930s–1940s American noir with painterly realism and an aged letterpress feel, using desaturated colors, soft contrast, and subtle paper grain; composition favors clean silhouettes, balanced framing, and restrained detail, keeping backgrounds abstract and readable without cinematic lighting or ornamentation. Overall tone is grounded and serious, evoking procedural crime, quiet menace, and tension without parody, fantasy, modern visual elements and no text. Faces must be distinct and non-recurring across images. Avoid reusing facial structure, age, hairline, jaw shape, or expression from prior images. Do not default to noir archetype faces (square-jawed fedora men, similar stubble, mirrored features). Each figure must occupy a different identity cluster, with clearly different bone structure, age cues, and presence. Prior images must not be visually recognizable in face, silhouette, or attire."

The texture used in the room background was created using the ChatGPT AI (https://chatgpt.com/) by uploading the library image and applying the following prompt: "Take this and strip out the emblem. Make it 103:168 ratio. Get rid of any border and make the corners square."

The courthouse building in the room background is by BruceEmmerling and is available under the Pixabay license from https://pixabay.com/photos/historic-building-philadelphia-4257401/.

The font is Libre Baskerville, copyright 2012 by The Libre Baskerville Project Authors with Reserved Font Name Libre Baskerville and is licensed for use under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1.
info.description: The prosecution's star witness can take the mafia down. But the witness has to make it from the safehouse to the courthouse, and the mafia will stop at nothing to eliminate him.
info.similarName: The Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
info.similarDesigner: Reiner Knizia, Eric M. Lang, Christian T. Petersen
info.similarAwards:
2014 Juego del Año Recommended
2007 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
2006 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
info.helpText:
Players sit in seats. Press the restart button to begin. The character cards are randomly distributed on the map in starting positions. Players may freely rearrange their character cards before starting. The player using the Bad Guy characters goes first.

Manually drag a character card from one region to another. When an attack is initiated, click on the appropriate character cards to reveal them to the other player. When revealed, an eye icon appears on the card as a reminder that the other player can see it. Click the character card again to show its back to the other player and remove the eye icon. To help prevent accidental disclosures a confirmation prompt appears. Characters that lose an attack should be manually dragged and dropped in the appropriate holder for defeated characters.

To play an action card, double click or drag it to the holder below the seat. Any cards left in that holder from previous attacks are automatically moved to the used card area whether you double click or drag and drop. Cards are displayed face down. Once both players have chosen a card, manually click to turn them over. Double click the card to send it to the used card area. When the ninth and final card is played, the remaining cards are automatically returned to the end. After resolving the effect of the final card, double click it or drag it back to the hand. This way both players start with all nine cards for the next attack.

There are player aids in the room. Hover the mouse over them for detailed information about character and card abilities and rules.

Rookie.name: Rookie
Rookie.description: Both Rookie and the Bad Guys' character are defeated

Escort.name: Escort
Escort.description: When with Witness strength = 5 and may replace Witness in battle

Prosecutor.name: Prosecutor
Prosecutor.description: The Bad Guys player must show their card first

Judge.name: Judge
Judge.description: The Good Guys' character ability has no effect

Thugs.name: Thugs
Thugs.description: When attacking, instantly defeat the first defender

Hit Squad.name: Hit Squad
Hit Squad.description: May move forward any number of regions to attack

Mole.name: Mole
Mole.description: May attack a single character that is alone in any region

Fixer.name: Fixer
Fixer.description: May decide that no cards are played

Button Man.name: Button Man
Button Man.description: When in Warehouse, may reveal to instantly defeat any character

Rookie.name: Rookie
Rookie.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When the Rookie is in an encounter, both the Rookie and the opposing Bad Guy are defeated before the Bad Guys’ ability is resolved. Exception: an encounter against the Judge where the Rookie’s ability has no effect and the encounter proceeds to playing cards.

Witness.name: Witness
Witness.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When defending, the Witness can choose to retreat sideways to an adjacent region. Retreating can only occur at the beginning of an encounter, before a card is played. You can never retreat sideways in the Industrial District, or into a region with a Bad Guy, or into a region that already has the maximum allowable Good Guys.

Decoy.name: Decoy
Decoy.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When attacking, the Decoy may retreat backward to an adjacent region. The Decoy can only use his ability to retreat at the beginning of an encounter, and not after cards are played.

Informant.name: Informant
Informant.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When in an encounter with the Don, the Informant automatically defeats the Don before cards are chosen. In an encounter against any other Bad Guy, the Informant’s character ability has no effect.

Escort.name: Escort
Escort.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
If the Escort is in the same space as the Witness, and the Witness is attacked first, the Escort may be revealed to take the Witness’s place in the attack (this must be done before you use the Witness’s ability). If this is done, the Escort’s strength becomes 5. The Good Guys must reveal the Witness (before cards are chosen) in order to prove the Escort’s strength. Alternatively, the Good Guys may choose not to reveal the Witness and keep the Escort’s strength at 2. If the Witness is battling the Judge, the Escort cannot replace the Witness. If the Escort is battling the Judge, the Escort's strength remains at 2, even if the Witness is in the same region. If the Thugs attack the Witness as their first attack, a switch to the Escort will result in the Thugs defeating the Escort. Reminder: As the character limit in the Industrial District is 1, the Escort cannot accompany the Witness in the same region within the Industrial District.

Sniper.name: Sniper
Sniper.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When in an encounter with the Mole, the Sniper defeats the Mole before cards are played. In an encounter against any other Bad Guy, the Sniper’s ability has no effect.

SWAT.name: SWAT
SWAT.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When in an encounter with the Thugs, the SWAT defeats the Thugs before the Thugs’ character ability is resolved. In an encounter against any other Bad Guy, the SWAT’s character ability has no effect.

Marshal.name: Marshal
Marshal.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When moving, the Marshal can move into any adjacent region (forward, sideways, or backward) if he attacks at least one Bad Guy by doing so. Otherwise, the Marshal can only move forward into an adjacent region as normal. The Marshal can attack the Judge using his special ability, since he uses his ability before he enters the space with the Judge. The Marshal cannot move sideways in the Industrial District.

Prosecutor.name: Prosecutor
Prosecutor.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
In an encounter against the Prosecutor, if characters must play cards, the Bad Guys must choose and reveal their card to the Good Guys first. After the Bad Guys have revealed their card, the Good Guys then choose their card. The Good Guys must play a card, even if the Bad Guys play their Withdrawal card after which, both cards are resolved as normal (with Bad Guys resolving text cards first). If the Bad Guys play their Backup Plan card, they must completely resolve it and reveal their new chosen card before the Good Guys choose and reveal their card. If the Bad Guys’ chosen card is a text card, do not resolve it until after the Good Guys have revealed their card choice.

Judge.name: Judge
Judge.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
In an encounter against the Judge, the opposing Good Guys' character ability has no effect.

Thugs.name: Thugs
Thugs.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When attacking, the Thugs defeat the first Good Guy attacked in a region before cards are played. If there are additional Good Guys in the space, the Thugs’ character ability has no effect in those subsequent encounters. A Good Guys' character with a retreat ability may retreat before the Thugs’ ability is resolved. If the Good Guy retreats, ending that encounter, that encounter is still considered the Thugs’ first attack (unless the Thugs were defending).

Hit Squad.name: Hit Squad
Hit Squad.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When moving, the Hit Squad can move forward any number of regions as long as they attack a region with at least one Good Guy by doing so. Otherwise, the Hit Squad must use the normal movement rules. The Hit Squad cannot move into or through a region already containing the maximum number of Bad Guys, nor can they move through a region occupied by one or more Good Guys.

Mole.name: Mole
Mole.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When moving, the Mole may move to any region on the board as long as that region is occupied by a single Good Guy (and so attacks the Good Guys' character). Otherwise, the Mole must use the normal movement rules. The Mole’s ability allows it to move sideways into an adjacent Industrial District region as long as that region is occupied by a single Good Guy.

Fixer.name: Fixer
Fixer.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
In an encounter with the Fixer, if the Good Guy does not retreat using its character ability, the Bad Guys may declare that no cards are to be played, and that an encounter is decided by the character strength alone. All other normal rules for an encounter apply.

Don.name: Don
Don.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
When moving, the Don can move sideways into an adjacent region if he attacks at least one Good Guy by doing so. Otherwise, the Don must use the normal movement rules. The Don cannot move sideways in the Industrial District. If the Don encounters the Witness in a sideways attack, the Witness may retreat sideways to the region previously occupied by the Don, as long as no other Bad Guys are there.

Capo.name: Capo
Capo.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
If the Capo defeats a Good Guy in an encounter, the Capo is immediately placed Downtown (unless the encounter took place in Downtown, in which case the Capo remains where he is). If there are already two other Bad Guys in Downtown, or if there are one or more Good Guys in Downtown, the Capo is defeated instead of relocated and is removed from the game.

Button Man.name: Button Man
Button Man.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
If the Button Man is in the Warehouse when a Good Guy uses the Tunnel (moving from Central Park directly to Midtown), the Bad Guys may reveal the Button Man to immediately defeat the Good Guy character (even the Witness) without an encounter. The Button Man himself remains unharmed (even the Rookie does not defeat the Button Man in this situation). A Good Guy character that is defeated by the Button Man when traveling through the Tunnel never reaches Midtown, so no Bad Guy in Midtown is revealed in an encounter.

Enforcer.name: Enforcer
Enforcer.detail:
${PROPERTY name}: ${PROPERTY strength}
In an encounter with the Enforcer, the Bad Guys’ card has no effect and no strength. Bad Guys must still play and discard a card, even though that card has no benefit in the encounter.

cards.detail:
Player Aid: Card Powers
Good Guys
Bad Guys
Evacuation: The Good Guy character moves backward to an adjacent region if the movement rules permit. Withdrawal: The Bad Guy character moves sideways into an adjacent region if the movement rules permit.This card has no effect in the Industrial District. This card prevents the Good Guy's Cover-Up card from taking effect.
Legal Maneuvers: Replace this card with one from the Good Guys' discard pile. If no cards have been discarded, this card has no effect. If the Bad Guys play their Backup Plan card at the same time, the Bad Guys choose their replacement first. Backup Plan: Replace this card with one from the Bad Guys' discard pile. If no cards have been discarded, this card has no effect. If the Good Guys play their Legal Maneuvers card at the same time, the Bad Guys choose their replacement first.
Cover-Up: Both characters are defeated unless the Bad Guys have played the Withdrawal card in which case both characters survive the encounter. Omertà: The text on the Good Guys' card is ignored. This card has no effect if the Good Guys played a strength card.
Protective Custody: If the Bad Guys played a strength card, it is ignored (including if chosen as a replacement after playing the Backup Plan card). +6
+5 +5
+4 +4
+3 +3
+2 +2
+1 +1

objects.css: background-color:#deb887;border: 2px solid black; border-radius:8px; text-align: center

movement.detail:
Player Aid: Movement
Basics - During their turn, a player must move one character forward one adjacent region. - Backward and sideways movement only happens when allowed by the text of a card played by a player or the text on the character's card. - Never move sideways in the Industrial District (the center 4 regions with icons and bordered in orange) unless specifically stated on the card. - Never have more than 4 characters in the Safehouse or the Courthouse. - Never have more than 1 character in each region in the Industrial District. - Never have more than 2 characters in all other regions. - Never move into or through a region that already has the maximum number of their own characters unless specifically stated on the card. - At any time a player may shuffle unrevealed characters from the same region by double clicking on that region.
Culvert - A Good Guy character can move using the Culvert in the direction from Casino Row, to Midtown, to the Theater District. This is considered forward. The Bad Guys cannot use the Culvert.
Tunnel - A Good Guy character can move using the Tunnel in the direction from Central Park to Midtown. A Good Guy character cannot retreat through the Tunnel and a Bad Guy character cannot use the Tunnel. If the Button Man is in the Warehouse and chooses to reveal this while a character is using the Tunnel, the Good Guy is instantly defeated without an encounter.
Victory - The game ends (a) when the Witness gets to the Courthouse (no encounter takes place as victory is immediate), (b) the Bad Guys get 3 characters to the Safehouse, (c) the Witness is defeated in battle, or (d) the player cannot move a character forward.

encounter.detail:
Player Aid: Encounters
Reveal Character - Both players reveal their character by clicking on them.
Resolve Text - The Good Guys' character text is applied first and then the Bad Guys' text. If the Judge is in the encounter, the Good Guys' character text is not applied. - A Good Guy character with a retreat ability may use that at this point (unless the Judge is in the encounter). If allowed to retreat in compliance with movement rules, the encounter ends immediately. - If either or both characters are defeated based on the character text, they are removed from the board immediately. - If both characters are still in the counter, continue to the next phase.
Play Cards - Select a card by double clicking on it or dragging it to the holder. Turn them over at the same time with a single click. - Text cards take effect before strength cards. - The Bad Guys' card is applied first and then the Good Guys' card. - If both characters are still in the counter, continue to the next phase.
Compare Strength - The value of any strength cards is added to the character's base strength. - If the strength of both characters is the same, they are both defeated and removed from the board. Otherwise, the one with the lower value is defeated and removed.
Repeat - Repeat the encounter resolution process for each remaning opposing character in the region.

Good Guys
Bad Guys
Cover-Up: Both characters are defeated unless the Bad Guy has played the Withdrawal card in which case both characters survive the encounter.Both players reveal their character by clicking on them.
